name: chirp
readme_summary: This application enables real-time data transmission via sound.  It encodes text into audio frequencies, transmits them, and decodes the received frequencies back into text, using start and end signatures for message demarcation.  A real-time frequency visualization aids in monitoring the process.
key_features: Real-time frequency visualization of audio input
Send messages by converting text to sound
Receive messages by listening to sound and decoding it back to text
Distinctive start and end signatures to mark transmissions
primary_use_case: Transmit and receive data through sound using a simple encoding scheme to convert text into audio frequencies

name: anon-kode
readme_summary: Anon Kode is a terminal-based AI coding tool utilizing OpenAI-style APIs.  It offers code fixing, functionality explanation, and execution of tests and shell commands.  The tool supports custom model selection and provides a built-in bug reporting mechanism.

name: Leffa
description: [CVPR 2025] Learning Flow Fields in Attention for Controllable Person Image Generation
readme_summary: Leffa is a unified framework for controllable person image generation, enabling precise manipulation of appearance and pose.  It uses a novel flow field regularization in the attention layer to reduce distortion in virtual try-on and pose transfer tasks.  The model supports float16 inference for faster generation and is designed to be model-agnostic, improving performance of other diffusion models.
primary_use_case: Generating high-quality person images with precise control over appearance and pose, minimizing distortion of fine-grained details.

name: revive
description: ðŸ”¥ ~6x faster, stricter, configurable, extensible, and beautiful drop-in replacement for golint
readme_summary: Revive is a fast and highly configurable linter for Go code, offering features like rule customization, per-file disabling, optional type checking, and extensibility.  It serves as a drop-in replacement for golint, providing enhanced performance and flexibility for code review and development processes.
key_features: Optional type checking for performance optimization
Extensible with custom rules and formatters

name: tweet-machine
description: This tool can retrieve :  1.Deleted tweets and replies ,Even if The account is suspended  2 .Old bios and Timestamp of The tweets
readme_summary: Tweet-Machine is a Twitter OSINT tool that retrieves deleted tweets and replies.  It produces three output files containing direct links, Wayback Machine links (for unavailable direct links), and a tweet timeline. This is useful for investigations where deleted Twitter data is relevant.
key_features: Retrieves deleted tweets and replies from any Twitter user, even suspended accounts

Generates three output files: a text file with tweet and reply direct links, a text file with Wayback Machine links for tweets with broken direct links, and a text file containing the timeline of each tweet
primary_use_case: OSINT (Open-Source Intelligence) investigation to recover deleted Twitter data

name: superfile
description: Pretty fancy and modern terminal file manager
readme_summary: Superfile is a cross-platform file management tool with support for Linux, macOS, and Windows.  It offers extensive customization options, including themes and hotkeys, and allows for extension via plugins. Installation is straightforward using various methods depending on the operating system.
key_features: Installation via bash script (Linux/macOS), PowerShell script (Windows), and Scoop (Windows)

name: Director
description: AI video agents framework for next-gen video interactions and workflows.
readme_summary: Director is a framework for building video agents that can process complex video tasks.  It features a chat-based interface, integrates with various AI APIs, and offers pre-built agents for tasks like summarization, editing, and generation.  The framework is built on VideoDB's video-as-data infrastructure.
key_features: 20+ pre-built video agents customizable for video summarization, movie generation with voiceovers, media library search and indexing, content organization and clipping, audio/video dubbing and editing, subtitle translation and addition
Chat-based interface with built-in video playback and intuitive controls
Integration with LLMs, databases, and GenAI APIs via VideoDB video infrastructure
primary_use_case: Building video agents to perform complex video tasks such as search, editing, compilation, and generation, and instantly streaming the results.

name: fingerprint-suite
description: Browser fingerprinting tools for anonymizing your scrapers. Developed by Apify.
readme_summary: The fingerprint-suite is a collection of npm packages for creating and injecting browser fingerprints.  It helps avoid detection by websites using fingerprinting techniques by generating realistic HTTP headers and browser fingerprints for use with Playwright or Puppeteer.  The suite includes tools for generating fingerprints, headers, and injecting them into a browser instance.
key_features: Browser fingerprint injection into Playwright and Puppeteer
Modular design with separate npm packages
Bayesian generative network for realistic fingerprint generation
primary_use_case: Generating and injecting realistic browser fingerprints to bypass website anti-scraping measures

name: Flexbox-Labs
description: A web app for creating flexible layouts with the power of CSS Flexbox.
readme_summary: Flexbox Labs is a visual tool that helps you create layouts using CSS Flexbox.  It offers an intuitive interface with real-time previews, allowing for easy experimentation and learning.  Users can add, delete, or duplicate items, edit properties, save layouts, and export the generated HTML and CSS code.
primary_use_case: Visual tool for creating CSS Flexbox layouts
